article_title: 'The unstoppable wars have destroyed our lives'
sentence: More  than  24,900  people  have  been  killed  in  Gaza  since  Israel  launched  its  response  to  the  7  October  Hamas  attacks,  according  to  the  Hamas-run  health  ministry.

article_title: 'The unstoppable wars have destroyed our lives'
sentence: The  Hamas  attack  in  Israel  killed  around  1,200  people,  most  of  them  civilians,  and  saw  240  hostages  taken  back  to  Gaza.

article_title: 'The unstoppable wars have destroyed our lives'
sentence: The  Israeli  army  has  destroyed  the  government  system,  killed  a  large  number  of  security  and  police  officers,  and  destroyed  security  headquarters  and  police  stations,  leaving  ordinary  crime  uncontrolled.

article_title: 'The unstoppable wars have destroyed our lives'
sentence: Correction  13th  February:  This  article  wrongly  reported  that  about  1,300  people  had  been  killed  following  the  7th  October  attack  by  Hamas.

article_title: 'The unstoppable wars have destroyed our lives'
sentence: This  was  based  on  counting  those  who  later  died  from  their  injuries  in  addition  to  the  figure  of  more  than  1,200.
